title: Heavy rains pose flood threat to Srikakulam, Vizianagaram districts

title: Pakistan's losses included radars, command and control centres, runways and hangars: IAF Chief on Operation Sindoor
content: Asked about Pakistan's losses during Operation Sindoor, he said in the air we have evidence of one long-range strike of Airborne Warning and Control System (AWACS) and four to five fighters

title: Congress, BJP express mistrust in TDB Vigilance probe into ‘misappropriation’ of Sabarimala artefacts
content: K.C. Venugopal seeks a Kerala High Court-monitored investigation by a higher agency, while V. Muraleedharan dares govt to hand over probe to CBI

title: Day after arrest, Assam court sends 2 band members to 14-day police remand in Zubeen Garg death case
content: The duo was present on the yacht in Singapore, where Garg died on September 19 while swimming in the sea

title: Couple dies in wall collapse in Andhra’s Srikakulam district
content: The neighbours took them to the hospital, located in Haripuram, where they succumbed to multiple injuries

title: Maruti Suzuki becomes first automaker to deliver cars to Kashmir by rail
content: The first consignment, which comprised over 100 Maruti Suzuki models including the Brezza, Dzire, WagonR, and S-Presso, departed from the firm’s recently inaugurated Manesar in-plant railway siding

title: Land acquisition for Kannur airport runway to be expedited, says Kerala CM
content: The process of acquiring 245.32 acres of land at Keezhalur and Kanad is under way, with the valuation of agricultural trees and buildings nearing completion

title: Tension in Bareilly: Security heightened in Bareilly ahead of Friday prayers
content: Drone cameras are being used to monitor the situation; internet restrictions remained in place in Bareilly and very few people were seen in markets

title: Jana Sena Party MP Tangella Uday Srinivas seeks Centre’s support to establish ITDA for 59 tribal villages in Kakinada district
content: The group of 59 tribal villages have been waging a battle to declare their villages as the 5th Schedule (Constitution of India) area to claim their entitlements

title: BJP sent delegation to Karur in cheap attempt to gain political mileage: T.N. CM Stalin
content: “Why is the BJP, which did not send a delegation for the Manipur violence, the Gujarat Morbi bridge collapse, or the deaths in the Maha Kumbh Mela stampede, promptly delegating a team to Karur?” Mr. Stalin asked in a social media post

title: CCPA fines Drishti IAS ₹5 lakh for misleading advertisements on UPSC results
content: Drishti IAS, in its advertisement, prominently claimed "216+ selections in UPSC CSE 2022" along with names and photographs of successful candidates

title: Tension grips Andhra’s Chittoor after miscreants vandalise Ambedkar statue
content: According to information, the miscreants poured petrol on the statue and its surrounding iron bars and pedestal, and set it on fire

title: Meghalaya’s tourism to get a boost as Shillong airport will accommodate wide-bodied aircraft
content: Meghalaya government commissioned a fresh study a few years ago, involving both independent agencies and the AAI

title: Zubeen Garg's autopsy report handed over to Indian authorities, Singapore Police confirms
content: According to the police, a copy of the autopsy report, along with their preliminary findings on his passing, has been handed over to the Indian authorities upon their request.

title: Punjab man in contact with ISI agents arrested with 2 hand grenades: Police
content: Preliminary investigation revealed that the arrested accused was in contact with Pakistan's ISI agents and had received the consignment from across the border

title: ‘I Love Muhammad’ row: J&K BJP leader threatens resignation, says U.P. CM’s remarks unacceptable
content: Jammu and Kashmir BJP leader Jahanzaib Sirwal said impartial investigations must hold all wrongdoers accountable and not just one community

title: Hoax bomb threats at residences of T.N. CM Stalin, Governor Ravi, and actor Trisha
content: Police sources said that at 4.10 a.m. on Friday (October 3, 2025), an email containing a bomb threat was sent from the ID ‘Sabarisan Vedamurthy’ to the office of the Tamil Nadu Director-General of Police

title: Five acquitted in 32-year-old murder case over torn records, lack of evidence
content: The judge found the key documents, including witness statements and the chargesheet, in a torn condition. The postmortem report was not available in the records.

title: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar transfers ₹10,000 each to 25 lakh women under employment scheme
content: Earlier on September 26, Prime Minister Narendra Modi had launched the scheme and had transferred the fund of ₹7500 crore to the bank accounts of 75 lakh women through video conferencing from Delhi

title: 2 dead, over 100 injured after ‘Devaragattu Banni Utsav’ turns violent in Andhra’s Kurnool
content: As the procession rolled out across the rural side, two rival groups, allegedly armed with thick bamboo sticks and pestles, joined the show and launched a violent attack on the other group

title: Partial remains of tiger found in MM Hills forest in Karnataka
content: A team led by Principal Chief Conservator of Forests (PCCF) Smita Bijoor has been directed to visit the spot near Pachchedoddi village where the partial remains of the tiger were found, and conduct a thorough inquiry

title: Two drown during idol immersion in Agra, CM Yogi expresses grief
content: Six others are still missing and teams of local divers, police personnel and the State Disaster Response Force (SDRF) have been pressed into service, officials said

title: Karnataka’s Shakti scheme bags world record recognition
content: Launched on June 11, 2023, as the first of the Congress government’s five guarantees, the Shakti scheme allows women, including transgender persons and students, to travel free of cost on non-premium State-run buses

title: Proud to see Bajaj, Hero and TVS do well in Colombia, can win with innovation not cronyism, says Rahul Gandhi
content: Rahul Gandhi, who is in Colombia during his four-nation tour of South America, posted a picture on X standing in front of a Bajaj Pulsar motorcycle

title: Not a smooth walk: Underused foot overbridges in Bengaluru pose safety risks
content: Adopting behavioural insights while commissioning new foot overbridges and skywalks can go a long way in improving the patronage of these facilities in the city, argues Liffy Thomas

title: Security forces arrest four militants including self-styled chief of Kuki outfit in Manipur
content: Security Forces arrested Paokholen Guite, the self-styled 'commander-in-chief' of Chin Kuki Mizo Army (CKMA) from S Munuam in Churachandpur districy

title: Watch: Kulasekarapattinam Dasara: a festival of faith, trance and transformation
content: Every year, the coastal town of Kulasekarapattinam transforms into a stage of devotion during Dasara. Thousands of devotees arrive in vibrant costumes, embodying gods, demons, and epic characters, as the beats of naiyandi melam echo through the night.

title: Why are the new rules for Panchayats in Odisha getting flak? | Explained
content: Why is the regional Biju Janata Dal party upset? Are bureaucrats getting power over elected representatives?

title: West Bengal tops country in acid attacks, crime against women drops marginally, reveals latest NCRB data
content: While the country recorded 207 cases of acid attacks in 2023, West Bengal alone accounted for 57 acid attacks under Section 326A of IPC. As per the data West Bengal alone accounted for 27.5 % of all acid attacks in the country.

title: UPA government’s decision not to act against Pakistan after 26/11 amounted to treachery: Eknath Shinde
content: In a recent podcast, former Union Minister Chidambaram suggested that he favoured military retribution following the 26/11 terror attack, but the UPA government eventually decided against such a move

title: Life-saving checks for early detection of cancer and prevention
content: Cancers often grow silently without symptoms, presenting at late stages when treatments are complex, expensive, and less effective. But when detected early, cancers are more often curable, require less aggressive treatments, and survival can improve dramatically

title: Violence in Bareilly | In the name of god
content: A message on an illuminated board that read ‘I love Muhammad’ during the Barawafat procession in Kanpur to celebrate the birth of the Prophet on September 4 led to violence, FIRs, arrests, an Internet shutdown, and bulldozer action in Bareilly, Uttar Pradesh. The Hindu finds that people are worried about their safety and that their businesses will suffer during peak festival season

title: IT Ministry opens real money games ban, esports registration rules, up for consultation
content: The draft Promotion and Regulation of Online Gaming Rules, 2025 would set up an Online Gaming Authority of India, and set a framework for registration of esports.

title: T.N. in worst position with regard to safety of Scheduled Castes, alleges Governor Ravi
content: He alleges that the SC community faced increasing problems, including not being able to walk freely on the streets and students are being divided in classrooms

title: Jawahirullah criticises Centre for releasing commemorative coin, stamp on centenary of RSS
content: He asserts that the portrayal of uniformed RSS volunteers as having taken part in the 1963 Republic Day parade on the stamp ‘amounted to distortion of history’

title: A startup revolution, the goal of ‘innovation capital’
content: Tamil Nadu’s strategy to facilitate startups and spark innovation is moving to the next chapter — as the Tamil Nadu Global Startup Summit 2025

title: Luxury drive on an illegal route
content: The Cochin Customs recently cracked down on the reported illegal import of luxury cars to India from neighbouring Bhutan and seized a few vehicles owned by movie actors and celebrities. M.P. Praveen finds out the modus operandi of the alleged smugglers and the illegal routes of vehicle import to India

title: Taliban ‘Foreign Minister’ Muttaqi to visit India next week
content: Indian officials indicated that the ‘temporary exemption’ that was issued by the UN Security Council’s sanctions committee on September 30 finally firmed up the plans for Muttaqi’s India visit

title: Police constables accused of rape in Tiruvannamalai dismissed from service
content: SP M. Sudhakar issues the order dismissing D. Suresh Raj and P. Sunder for raping a young woman from Andhra Pradesh

title: Rahul Gandhi ‘speaking in the tongue of Pakistan’, says Eknath Shinde
content: At the annual Dussehra celebrations organised by his party, Maharashtra Deputy CM Eknath Shinde criticizes Rahul Gandhi for doubting the bravery of soldiers, Uddhav Thackeray for giving up Hindutva

title: Fighting for justice and rights is being termed sedition in this country, says Uddhav
content: Shiv Sena(UBT) chief calls Modi-led NDA government “shameless” for comparing cricket with war, says Hindus are not safe under government

title: 11 killed as tractor-trolley falls into pond during Durga idol immersion in Madhya Pradesh
content: Khandwa Collector Rishav Gupta said the locals and a home guard posted near the immersion site had warned the tractor driver against going ahead but he did not listen, and the tractor plunged into water after losing control.

title: It would be a shame if India found supplying weapons to Israel: Navi Pillay
content: In this interview, the former UN High Commissioner for Human Rights who chaired the Commission which spent two years documenting over 60,000 Palestinian deaths discusses the findings, the legal and moral obligations of the international community

title: Central Secretariat Service Forum demands probe into attempted suicide of official due to workplace harassment
content: The Central government staff had jumped from the seventh-floor office of the Social Justice and Empowerment Ministry but survived the fall; father says he spoke of harassment by senior officers and feeling depressed

title: Congress launches revamp of U.P. organisation; focus on Jats, Gurjars, Passi, Nishad, Lodhi, forward castes
content: Congress plans to appoint 2 million office-bearers in UP, engaging with caste groups to revive party fortunes.

title: Several NDA allies send congratulatory messages to the RSS on centenary
content: The congratulatory messages from the NDA partners, many of whom also receive support from minority communities, is significant in what it says about the inner cohesion of the alliance

title: Experts, citizens slam Karnataka’s plan for metro line to Tumakuru, call suburban rail a better alternative
content: The proposed line would cost an estimated ₹20,649 crore in its first phase, this figure has raised eyebrows among citizens and mobility advocates

title: Integrated Child Development Services has been renamed, but its governance hasn’t kept pace, says Jairam Ramesh
content: Recalling 50 years of the ICDS, renamed and subsumed under the Mission Saksham Anganwadi and POSHAN 2.0, Congress flags the need for additional workers, services, and funds

title: Andaman L-G briefs PM Modi on progress of mega projects on islands
content: Lieutenant Governor Admiral D.K. Joshi (Retd)  apprised the PM Modi of the highest-ever tourist arrivals in the Andaman and Nicobar Islands, with domestic arrivals up by 41% and foreign arrivals by 27% over the past year

title: Seemanchal: religion, caste and the never-ceasing struggle for livelihoods
content: The demography of the place, the overarching influence of the Bharatiya Janata Party from the Centre, and the fragmented polity ensure that simple equations of communal and caste support continue to over-determine electoral variables in the region

title: Israel conducting ‘genocidal war’ on Gaza, says Palestinian Ambassador
content: Abdullah M. Abu Shawesh was addressing an event organised by the Left Democratic Front at the Muthalakkulam Ground in Kozhikode to express solidarity with the Palestinian people

title: Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan compares RSS to Zionists in Israel
content: Opposition criticises release of commemorative stamp and coin on Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh centenary

content: “Why should the police file a case against four functionaries of the TVK and arrest two of them? On the other hand Mr. Vijay is being given security. Then, can we say that there is secret understanding between the DMK and Mr. Vijay?”

title: Thrissur comes alive with Vidyarambham ritual as children step into the world of letters
content: The ceremony, blending spirituality with cultural heritage, was celebrated at temples and institutions across the district

title: Old clothes to get a makeover at this training programme
content: Mithrakulam Charitable Trust in Ernakulam to train at least 10 people at their place on designing and creating unique products out of old clothes

title: Muslim girl performs Kathakali at Kerala Kalamandalam for the first time in 95 years
content: 16-year-old Sabri makes her debut in the Krishna ‘vesham.’ She joined the institution in 2023 and was taught the first ‘mudras’ by maestro Kalamandalam Gopi

title: Anusandhan National Research Foundation’s SARAL tool to simplify scientific research papers
content: The new tool will generate lay person summaries of complex scientific research, Shivkumar Kalyanaraman, the CEO of India’s newest science funding agency said

title: RMC issues intense rainfall forecast for north and interior districts till October 5
content: While some areas of Chennai may receive spells of moderate rain on October 3, the city and other north districts, such as Vellore and Ranipet, are likely to get intense rainfall on October 4

title: Religious rites, ceremonial traditions mark Wadiyars’ Dasara
content: Unlike the State-sponsored festival, which is more of cultural events and sports, the Navaratri, as celebrated by the Wadiyars, entails rigorous observance of religious rites as prescribed in sacred texts under the supervision of trained priests

title: Gandhi adopting the principle of non-violence made him a Mahatma, says Shashil Namoshi
content: The BJP MLC was addressing a programme marking the 156th birth anniversary of Mahatma Gandhi in Kalaburagi

title: Kannammoola-Nellikuzhy road work to be taken up soon
content: Residents of the area have been facing difficulties due to the road, which has been in a state of disrepair for a long time. Autorickshaw drivers as well as food delivery workers have generally been reluctant to venture into the road

title: Telangana second only to Karnataka in cyber crimes; Hyderabad among worst-hit metros
content: The State accounted for 21.1% of the 86,420 cyber cases reported across India, highlighting its position as the country’s epicentre of digital offences

title: Schlittler historic in 12-K gem as Yanks oust Sox
content: Rookie Cam Schlittler became the first pitcher in postseason history to go at least eight scoreless innings with 12-plus strikeouts and no walks, as the Yankees advanced to the ALDS with a 4-0 win over the Red Sox on Thursday night.

title: Niners' Jones beats odds, lets it fly in career night
content: Battling through a sprained knee and cramping forearm, Mac Jones threw for 342 yards and two touchdowns to lead the Niners past the Rams 26-23 in overtime on Thursday night.

title: Cubs quash Padres' threat in 9th to make NLDS
content: The Cubs held off a ninth-inning rally by the Padres for a clinching 3-1 victory Thursday night that sends them to the NL Division Series against the Brewers.

title: Bogaerts laments 'terrible' call, pines for ABS
content: Count Xander Bogaerts among those looking forward to Major League Baseball's new challenge system for balls and strikes next season. The San Diego Padres shortstop just wishes it were in place a little earlier.

title: Clark: Collier made 'valid points' about Engelbert
content: Fever star Caitlin Clark said Napheesa Collier "made a lot of very valid points" this week when the Minnesota Lynx star ripped WNBA commissioner Cathy Engelbert.

title: PGA of America prez apologizes to Rory, Euros
content: PGA of America president Don Rea Jr. apologized to Rory McIlroy and the European Ryder Cup team, condemning fan behavior that "crossed the line" at Bethpage.

title: Nev. court rejects NFL plea for Gruden rehearing
content: Thursday's unanimous ruling by the Nevada Supreme Court means the last option for the NFL is to appeal to the U.S. Supreme Court, which sources told ESPN is likely.

content: David Ross, the former Braves catcher and Cubs manager, said Thursday that returning as manager of the Braves "would be amazing."

content: A'ja Wilson's Aces seek their third title in four years. Phoenix is chasing its first since 2014. The Finals open Friday.

content: Here are the top scenes from Abu Dhabi as the Philadelphia 76ers and New York Knicks face off in a preseason doubleheader.

content: The top free agent from the summer is ready to begin a new chapter with an elite Western Conference contender.

title: The time for experimentation is over: USMNT squad sees Pochettino's World Cup vision come into focus
content: Mauricio Pochettino has been experimenting with his USMNT lineup for some time, but judging by his October squad, his World Cup team is taking shape.

title: Bayern Munich, Atletico Madrid ... Qarabag? Making sense of Champions League MD2
content: Big clubs (Bayern Munich, Atletico Madrid) and small ones (FK Qarabag?!) shone on Champions League MD2 as several results made an impact on teams' chances of advancing. Let's break down the teams, matches and power ranking.

content: We look at every World Cup ball, from the first almost 100 years ago to the new Trionda that will be used in Canada, Mexico and the U.S. next summer.

content: An all-encompassing look at the matchups to exploit or avoid and lineup locks in fantasy, as well as projected scores for all NFL games.

content: Here's a look at how the latest tweak to kickoffs resulted in yet another big jump in special teams action.

content: From trades to free agency to the draft, these teams will see boosts -- or declines -- from a summer of deals.

content: In seeming to not embrace the player who singlehandedly lifted the WNBA, the league risks losing her fan base.

title: Betting buzz: Ravens swing from favorite to underdog amid Jackson injury rumors
content: Amid speculation around Lamar Jackson's hamstring injury, the Ravens have swung from favorite to underdogs on Sunday.

content: The NFL went international in Week 5. Here's how Minnesota and Cleveland made the trip worth remembering in London.

content: Andreas Hale on what's next for Gervonta Davis after Jake Paul, Terence Crawford's next move and more.

content: The top Premier League teams have passed the ball in certain ways that betray either a weakness or a strength. What have we learned so far?

title: Every time Man United's Ruben Amorim has talked about his job
content: Ahead of a must-win match against Sunderland, here is everything Amorim has said about his job so far.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Mexico's Mora on Arsenal, City, Madrid, Barça radar
content: Mexico teenager Gilberto Mora is being tracked by Arsenal, Manchester City, Real Madrid and Barcelona. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: 2026 class: Risers, teams with early edges, more
content: Which five-star recruits are still on the board? What to know with six weeks until the early signing window.

title: Draft guide: All you need to win your league this season
content: We've got everything you need to help you prepare for and execute a successful draft, all in one place.

title: '4-5 F-16s destroyed': IAF chief on what turned tables in Op Sindoor; calls Pak narrative 'manohar kahaniyan'
content: Indian Air Force Chief Amar Preet Singh discussed Operation Sindoor. He stated the four-day campaign achieved its objectives swiftly. India avenged innocent killings and brought Pakistan to its knees. Newly inducted long-range surface-to-air missiles were crucial. They achieved a 300 km kill. The media also helped manage disinformation during the conflict. India responded to the Pahalgam terror attack.

title: 'Drug kingpin': Ex-NSG commando held with 200kg ganja; was once part of 26/11 terror op
content: Former NSG commando Bajrang Singh, who participated in the 2008 Mumbai terror operation, was arrested in Rajasthan for allegedly masterminding a large-scale cannabis smuggling network. Police recovered 200kg of the drug, stating he was the kingpin transporting it from Telangana and Odisha. This arrest is a significant step against the terror-narcotics nexus.

title: 'Fake news': Yunus plays down violence against minorities in B'desh; rights group hits back
content: Bangladesh's interim leader Muhammad Yunus dismissed widespread reports of anti-Hindu violence as "fake news," accusing India of spreading misinformation. He insisted incidents were ordinary disputes, not religious persecution, advising Hindus to seek protection as citizens. This stance drew sharp criticism from minority groups, who accused him of denying the truth and backtracking on previous admissions.

title: 'Golden palace will burn': Congress leader Udit Raj takes 'Ravan' jibe at PM Modi
content: Congress leader Udit Raj ignited a political storm by calling Prime Minister Narendra Modi the “Ravana of Delhi,” predicting his imminent downfall. BJP's Shehzad Poonawala swiftly condemned these remarks, questioning the Congress party's intentions. Raj further commented on India's foreign policy challenges, including a Taliban minister's visit and US tariffs, while dismissing reports of internal party conflict in Karnataka.

title: US shutdown halts H-1B visas: Indian workers risks legal status; no end date
content: The US government shutdown, effective October 1, has brought H-1B visa processing to a standstill, severely impacting Indian professionals. The Department of Labor's closure prevents critical LCA approvals, freezing new applications, transfers, and green card processes. This indefinite halt, amid proposed fee hikes, creates significant uncertainty for thousands of high-skilled workers and businesses.

title: ‘Indian economy resilient, can absorb shocks’: Sitharaman amid 50% US tariffs
content: Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman highlighted India's growing economic resilience amid intensifying global geopolitical tensions, asserting the nation is well-equipped to absorb external shocks. She emphasized that current disruptions signify a structural transformation, urging India to actively shape outcomes and ensure inclusivity in new forms of cooperation, leveraging its evolving economic influence.

title: Alternatives to Russia oil: India ramps up supplies to Brazil, Turkey, UAE
content: Indian refiners are filling fuel supply gaps in Russia's primary markets, including Brazil and Turkey. This follows Ukrainian drone attacks that damaged Russian refining capabilities, leading Moscow to reduce fuel exports and prioritize domestic needs.

title: 'Fingers chopped': Auto driver murdered in front of his children; gang rivalry suspected
content: A 38-year-old man was murdered in Chhatrapati Sambhajinagar. Syed Imran was attacked by a group of men. His young children witnessed the brutal killing. Police arrested two suspects quickly. The incident is a suspected revenge killing linked to a gang conflict. The alleged mastermind, Syed Mujeeb, was later apprehended. This murder stemmed from a prior clash.

title: Elon Musk's $1 trillion pay: Tesla responds to letter sent to shareholders
content: A coalition of Tesla shareholders, including state officials, is urging investors to reject Elon Musk's proposed $1 trillion compensation package and the re-election of three directors. They cite declining performance and lack of oversight as reasons. Tesla defends the plan, stating it aligns Musk's pay with shareholder value creation and highlights significant returns under his leadership.

title: 'Koi nazdeek rehta toh': SKY's cheeky comment goes viral - Watch
content: India's T20I skipper Suryakumar Yadav, fresh from leading India to the Asia Cup 2025 title, charmed fans in Mumbai with a witty remark that quickly went viral. Despite his team's unbeaten run and triumph over Pakistan in the final, the 35-year-old had a personally quiet tournament, scoring only 72 runs.

title: 'Await my meeting with dear friend': Russian President Putin to visit India
content: Speaking about India-Russia relations, Putin said, "Our relations with India are of special nature ever since the Soviet Union and since the days where the Indian people fought for their independence. India knows, remembers, appreciates that. And we appreciate the fact that India never forgets that. And so our relations are developing."

title: Zubeen Garg case: Singapore shares autopsy report with India - Why bandmate & singer arrested
content: Singapore Police shared Zubeen Garg's autopsy report with Indian authorities following his death last month. Assam Police arrested four individuals, including the manager and festival organiser, invoking murder charges. Investigations are ongoing, with a Special Investigation Team formed and financial crime allegations also being probed against the organiser.

title: US govt shuts down: Embassy in India gives update; X account won’t be updated until…
content: The US government has shut down for the first time in nearly seven years after Republicans and Democrats failed to agree on federal funding. This halt means "non-essential" services like visa processing and national parks close, while "essential" workers continue without pay. The US Embassy in India also announced reduced updates, except for urgent safety information.

title: Watch: Explosion sparks fire at Chevron refinery in Los Angeles
content: A massive fire erupted at the Chevron refinery in El Segundo Thursday night following an explosion, sending bright flames and thick smoke visible for miles. Firefighters are working to contain the blaze at the large West Coast facility, though no injuries or evacuations have been reported. The cause of the incident remains unclear.

title: IND vs WI: In five words! Wife Athiya reacts to KL Rahul's celebration
content: KL Rahul scored his 11th Test century against West Indies. This was his first home hundred in nine years. He dedicated the milestone to his baby daughter with a special gesture. His wife Athiya Shetty shared an emotional message online. Rahul was dismissed soon after reaching his century. His innings helped India gain control of the match.

title: 'Lost balance': How a single misstep turned fatal during Durga idol immersion in MP; 11 dead
content: Eleven youths, including eight minors, drowned on Thursday evening when a tractor-trolley carrying Durga idol immersion devotees overturned in a pond in Khandwa, Madhya Pradesh. The vehicle lost balance while reversing, despite a warning, leading to the tragic incident. Chief Minister Mohan Yadav announced Rs 4 lakh ex-gratia for each deceased family.

title: FIDE rankings: Gukesh out of top 10; Erigaisi becomes India No. 1
content: Indian chess witnessed a landmark September as Arjun Erigaisi ascended to world number four and Nihal Sarin joined the elite 2700 club. Vaishali Rameshbabu secured a Women's Candidates spot, while Divya Deshmukh also impressed. Junior prodigies like Pranav Venkatesh, Abhimanyu Mishra, and Ashwath Kaushik achieved significant rating gains, underscoring India's burgeoning status as a global chess powerhouse.

title: India-Russia trade: Putin orders to step up imports; ‘losses faced by India due to US tariffs…’
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin is pushing to deepen trade ties with India, instructing officials to increase imports of Indian agricultural goods and pharmaceuticals. This move aims to address the trade imbalance caused by India's substantial crude oil purchases, especially as India faces US tariffs.

title: 'One can say 'I love Modi' but not 'I love Mohammad': Owaisi amid Bareilly unrest
content: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi criticized the treatment of Muslims in India, highlighting objections to "I love Mohammad" slogans amidst Bareilly protests. He condemned the violence but accused authorities of mishandling the situation, urging Muslims to act lawfully. Owaisi also questioned the government's law and order record, citing recent demolitions.

title: Watch: Never seen before! KL Rahul dazzles fans with unique celebration
content: KL Rahul scored his 11th Test century, marking his first home ton in nearly nine years and ending a significant drought. He celebrated uniquely by dedicating the milestone to his baby daughter, adding an emotional dimension to his redemption. This crucial century, achieved after 26 innings, helped solidify India's strong position against the West Indies.

title: Drones deployed, internet suspended: Bareilly on alert ahead of Friday prayers - Top developments
content: Bareilly suspended internet services and tightened security ahead of Friday prayers, fearing unrest after last week's clashes over an 'I Love Muhammad' row. Authorities placed prominent leaders like Chandrashekhar Azad under house arrest to prevent their visit. The administration is also surveying properties for demolition, targeting alleged rioters and their supporters.

title: 'Prepared to block everything': Protests erupt across Europe after Israel stops aid boats
content: Israeli forces intercepted the Global Sumud Flotilla attempting to break the Gaza blockade, detaining 450 activists. This action triggered massive worldwide protests and strong condemnation from nations like Turkey and Colombia, with Colombia expelling Israeli diplomats. The flotilla sought to establish a humanitarian corridor amidst the ongoing conflict and blockade.

title: No distraction! 'Dhoni used to leave his phone in hotel room'
content: MS Dhoni's remarkable detachment from phones and social media continues to inspire, a trait highlighted by former teammate R Sai Kishore. Kishore, who transformed into a top T20 spinner after leaving CSK, revealed Dhoni's focus on basics and process. This consistent leadership approach, emphasizing control over distractions, profoundly influenced Kishore's career and development, showcasing Dhoni's enduring impact on young talent.

title: UAE bank stops SMS OTP, moves to app-based approvals for all transfers
content: Emirates NBD is phasing out SMS and email OTPs, transitioning to app-based verification through its ENBD X mobile app starting November 1, 2025. This Central Bank-mandated shift aims to significantly enhance transaction security against fraud and improve customer experience.

title: ‘She couldn’t get out’: Parents sue Tesla; say door flaw killed girl after fire
content: Parents sued Tesla after their 19-year-old daughter died in a burning Cybertruck, alleging a design flaw prevented her escape. They claim Tesla knew about the stuck-door issue and difficult manual releases for years. This lawsuit coincides with a federal investigation into similar complaints, raising further safety concerns for the company.

title: Putin hits back at Trump's 'paper tiger' jibe; asks what is Nato then?
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin challenged Donald Trump's "paper tiger" remark, questioning NATO's strength if Russia is advancing against the entire bloc in Ukraine. Putin also warned that US Tomahawk missile supplies would mark a new escalation stage, dismissing NATO's claims of Russian aggression while asserting Russia's confidence.

title: India develops powerful, homegrown antibiotic to tackle multi-drug-resistant bacteria
content: The complex structure of Gram-negative bacteria, protects them from various antibiotic treatments. These bacteria create severe hospital-based infections which affect urinary tracts and bloodstreams and lead to pneumonia and wound infections. The development of antibiotic resistance in Gram-negative bacteria has led to multiple antibiotic failures which makes their treatment extremely challenging

title: FBI director fires trainee for displaying gay pride flag, calls it ‘inappropriate’
content: FBI Director Kash Patel dismissed an agent trainee for displaying a gay pride flag, citing an "improper political message" and poor judgment. The dismissal, which occurred during a government shutdown and referenced Trump's Article II powers, has raised concerns among FBI agents and highlighted growing worries about LGBTQ representation in federal agencies.

title: 'Starting to kick in': Trump hints at $1,000–$2,000 'tariff dividend' for Americans; what it means
content: President Trump suggested giving Americans $1,000-$2,000 rebates from tariff revenues, which he claims will exceed $1 trillion annually. He plans to use these funds to reduce the national debt first, then distribute the remainder. This comes as the Supreme Court prepares to rule on the tariffs' legality, potentially requiring massive refunds.

title: Trump’s campus compact: Top US universities under pressure; academic freedom at risk
content: The Trump administration has urged nine top US universities, including UT Austin and MIT, to sign a “Compact for Academic Excellence in Higher Education” to secure priority access to federal funding. The compact demands tuition freezes, limits on international students, bans on DEI policies, and restrictions on political expression. Universities face funding risks if they refuse, raising concerns about academic freedom and institutional governance under new federal conditions.

title: Gold price prediction: What's the outlook for today?
content: Gold price prediction today: Gold prices are expected to maintain bullish momentum long-term, but intraday traders can consider a "sell on rise" strategy today. Technical indicators suggest a temporary correction due to overbought conditions and profit-booking near the 117250-117400 resistance. This high-risk, short-term trade targets 116400 with a stop-loss at 118200.

title: 'Forcing our hand': Indian films pulled from Canadian theatre after arson attack — What we know
content: Oakville's Film.Ca Cinemas has cancelled all future South Asian film screenings following two violent attacks on its premises, including an attempted arson and a shooting. The theatre cited safety concerns for staff and guests, believing these incidents are directly linked to its exhibition of Indian films. Police are actively investigating these targeted overnight attacks.

title: NFL 2025 overtime rules explained after Cowboys-Packers tie
content: A rare 40-40 overtime tie between the Dallas Cowboys and Green Bay Packers marked the NFL season's first, ending on a walk-off field goal. This unusual outcome, the fifth such tie in a decade, highlights the impact of new NFL rules.

title: Explained: Cheques to be cleared within hours from tomorrow
content: India's cheque clearing system is set for a major overhaul from October 4, transitioning to a continuous, near real-time process. This significant change will drastically reduce fund transfer times from days to just a few hours, offering customers and businesses faster access to money. Cheques will be processed throughout the day with hourly settlements, ensuring quicker payments nationwide.

title: US govt shutdown, round two: How Trump’s last standoff unfolded — What comes next
content: President Trump's government shutdown has plunged the US into crisis, with mass furloughs and imminent layoffs as he aims to reshape federal power and punish Democrats. This standoff, echoing 2018-19 but potentially more severe, sees Democrats demanding healthcare subsidies while Republicans prioritize reopening government, risking prolonged disruption and political backlash.

title: ‘Azad Kashmir’ controversy: Who is Sana Mir? Ex-Pak captain in hot water
content: Former Pakistan captain Sana Mir faced heavy criticism for an on-air remark referring to “Azad Kashmir” during the Women’s World Cup broadcast, prompting accusations of politicization. Mir clarified her comments, stating they were taken out of context to highlight a player's challenges. Concurrently, Pakistan struggled on the field, losing their opening match to Bangladesh by seven wickets.

title: Chiefs' Heiress Gracie Hunt shares life of big games and heartfelt moments
content: Chiefs heiress Gracie Hunt experienced an unforgettable September, seamlessly blending high-stakes NFL games, international travel, and cherished personal moments. Despite a demanding schedule, she embraced every experience with gratitude, prioritizing connections with her boyfriend, family, and friends. Her journey exemplifies balancing professional ambition with heartfelt personal experiences, showcasing how intentionality transforms a busy life into a meaningful one.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens below 24,800; BSE Sensex down over 170 points
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in red on Friday. While Nifty50 was below 24,800, BSE Sensex was down over 170 points.

title: Hair pulled, slapped: Woman beats mother-in-law in Punjab; grandson films assault
content: A Gurdaspur woman, Harjeet Kaur, brutally assaulted her elderly mother-in-law, Gurbhajan Kaur, over a property dispute, captured in a viral video by her grandson. The Punjab State Commission for Women initiated an investigation, but the victim declined to press charges, stating it was a family matter. This disturbing incident has sparked widespread outrage.

title: European leaders mock Trump over Armenia-Albania gaffe— Watch
content: Former US President Donald Trump faced widespread amusement from world leaders, including Albanian PM Edi Rama and French President Emmanuel Macron, after repeatedly confusing Armenia with Albania. Trump boasted about brokering a peace deal in the South Caucasus, mistakenly claiming he settled a conflict involving Albania.

title: Handshake row: Will India continue to avoid Pakistan in CWC? BCCI responds
content: The Women's ODI World Cup 2025 will feature an India-Pakistan match on October 5 in Colombo, raising questions about player interactions after the men's team's recent refusal to handshake. While BCCI assures adherence to cricket protocols, handshakes remain uncertain. Meanwhile, Bangladesh secured a dominant victory over Pakistan in a recent World Cup fixture, highlighting strong batting and bowling.

title: 'There could be firings': Trump's warning amid US govt shutdown; hints at 'big plans'
content: Donald Trump warned of potential firings and project cuts if the government shutdown continues, blaming Democrats for the crisis. With non-essential services halted and federal workers furloughed, Trump also hinted at "big plans" for 2026, citing dangerous political rhetoric. The standoff centers on Affordable Care Act subsidies, threatening economic disruption and mass layoffs.

title: Deepika Padukone’s trainer shares no-equipment belly fat workout, coach warns
content: Celebrity trainer Yasmin Karachiwala shares a 6-step no-gym core workout for building strength and improving posture. However, fitness coach Raj Ganpath clarifies that spot reduction is a myth. Sustainable belly fat loss requires a consistent calorie deficit through clean eating, regular movement, and avoiding extreme dieting, rather than just ab exercises.

content: When you're in the late rounds of your draft, here are the players you should look at and the key reason why.

title: Kebab To Burgers: Chef Yasmin Nasir Shares Recipes To Support Gazans
content: On her social media accounts, Yasmin has been educating Gazans to modify traditional recipes with basic, everyday items through brief films and recipe guidelines.

title: Video: Los Angeles Sky Turns Orange As Fire Breaks Out At Chevron's Oil Refinery
content: A fireball lit up the night sky in Los Angeles on Thursday after an explosion that led to a massive fire at a Chevron refinery in LA County's El Segundo area.

title: Delhi Man Kidnaps Ex-Girlfriend's Son, Sets 'Return To Me' Condition
content: A seven-year-old boy, allegedly kidnapped by his mother's former live-in partner in a bid to pressure her into returning to him, was rescued by police. The prime accused and his three associates have been arrested, an official said on Friday.

title: Why Are Cars Heavier Than Bikes? Rahul Gandhi Explains, BJP Takes Jibe
content: Why does a motorcycle weigh 100 kg while a car is much heavier at 3,000 kg? Leader of Opposition Rahul Gandhi, currently on a trip to Colombia, posed this question to a packed seminar hall in the Latin American country.

title: Centre Releases Draft Online Gaming Rules, Proposes New Regulator: Key Takeaways
content: The Promotion and Regulation of Online Gaming (PROG) Act, 2025, bans real money gaming platforms such as online poker, rummy and fantasy sports.

title: Does Instagram Really Listen To Your Conversations? CEO Answers
content: Instagram CEO Adam Mosseri has put to rest a widely circulated myth among social media users that the platform listens to private conversations and serves ads based on them.

title: 1 In 5,00,000: Newborn In Karnataka Discovered With Twin Growing Inside
content: Doctors in Karnataka have reported an extremely rare and unusual medical case in which a newborn male baby was found to have another baby developing inside his abdomen, a condition known as Fetus in Fetu (FIF).

title: Karnataka Woman Murders 12-Year-Old Daughter, Then Kills Self
content: The bodies were discovered when her husband, who works as a lab technician at the hospital, returned home after his night shift and found the door locked.

title: Himachal Pradesh Now Home To 83 Snow Leopards, Count Up By 62% In 4 Years
content: The population of rare snow leopards in high-altitude tribal areas of Himachal Pradesh has increased by 62 per cent over the past four years, says a newly released survey.

title: "I Collapsed On Floor": Telegram Founder Recalls 2018 Poisoning Attack
content: Pavel Durov said that he lost his hearing and vision before he began experiencing respiratory difficulties.

title: Drishti IAS To Pay Rs 5 Lakh Fine For Misleading Ads On UPSC Results
content: The Central Consumer Protection Authority (CCPA) has imposed a penalty of Rs 5 lakh on Drishti IAS (VDK Eduventures Pvt Ltd) for publishing misleading advertisements regarding the results of the UPSC Civil Services Examination (CSE) 2022.

title: Explained: How To Create Your Lifelike AI Avatar On OpenAI's Sora 2
content: You can use the Sora 2 model to create your cameo play beach volleyball or wrestle an elephant. All of this is possible with only text prompts.

title: Security Tightened In Bareilly Ahead Of Friday Evening Prayers
content: Security was strengthened in several sensitive areas here ahead of the evening prayers on Friday, a week after the city witnessed violence following the congregational prayers.

title: Video: Pakistan Police Raid Islamabad Press Club Amid PoK Protest
content: As Pakistan boils over alleged atrocities and internet blackout in violence-hit Pakistan-Occupied Kashmir (POK), police in Islamabad stormed the National Press Club (NPC), where several journalists were attacked.

title: Can Made-In-India Arattai Replace WhatsApp? 5 Features That Set It Apart
content: For years, WhatsApp held an unshakable monopoly in the messaging space, with over half a billion active users in India. Now, Arattai, a made-in-India messaging app developed by Zoho Corp, is emerging as a tough competitor.

title: Wars Are Redrawing Boundaries Of Cooperation, Conflict: Nirmala Sitharaman
content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Friday said India's capacity to absorb external shocks is strong at a time when the world economy is undergoing a structural transformation.

title: "You Think It Won't Happen To Us": Prince William On Kate's Cancer Diagnosis
content: Prince William also opened up about how their children, Prince George, 12, Princess Charlotte, 10, and Prince Louis, 7, were affected by Kate's cancer diagnosis.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Why Bishnoi Gang - Now A 'Terror Entity' - Continues To Haunt India-Canada Ties
content: Canada continues to prioritise foreign interference and transnational repression as central to its national security agenda, even as it overlaps and at times undermines Indias concern about Khalistani separatism.

title: Meet The 5 Candidates Competing To Be Japan's Next Prime Minister
content: Japan's long-governing Liberal Democratic Party will choose a new leader Saturday to replace Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba, but the winner must quickly restore political stability and regain public support for the struggling party to stay in power.

title: Karnataka Woman Claims Husband Recorded Her Videos, Pressured Her To Sleep With Others
content: The woman filed a police complaint against her husband and in-laws, accusing them of harassment, blackmail, and exploitation.
